name: Rota's basis conjecture
rephrased: Given a collection of n disjoint bases in a vector space (or matroid of rank n), it is possible to arrange the elements into an n by n matrix such that each row forms one of the bases and each column also forms a basis.
implication_form: If there exists a vector space (or matroid) of rank n containing n disjoint bases, then these bases can be arranged into an n × n matrix where each row and each column is a basis.
explained: Rota's basis conjecture states that for any vector space of dimension n or more generally for any matroid of rank n, if there are n disjoint bases (each containing n elements), then it is possible to arrange the elements of these bases into an n × n matrix such that each row forms one of the given bases, and each column also forms a basis.
